thread.title: Premier League April TV fixtures: Man Utd v Chelsea on Sky | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Premier League April TV fixtures: Man Utd v Chelsea on Sky | Daily Mail Online

author: Oliver Todd For Mailonline
title: Premier League April TV fixtures: Man Utd v Chelsea on Sky | Daily Mail Online
text: Share 291 shares Sportsmail understands juggling the hectic Premier League schedule with other competitions has proved a big challenge for Sky. However, in the north London and Merseyside derbies â€” and Chelsea's visit to United, they have three of the biggest games in April's batch of selections. BT Sport viewers will be treated to the rematch between Chelsea and Manchester City BT Sport show United's home games against Everton and Swansea City, as well as their prime pick of Chelsea vs Manchester City on April 5. Arsenal vs Tottenham, set for April 30 in a 4.30pm kick-off, is optimistically marked up as 'subject to Arsenal's possible participation in the Champions League semi-finals', despite their expected exit at the hands of Bayern Munich. Sky Sports head of football Gary Hughes said: 'Sky Sports is the place to see the remaining big fixtures as the Premier League heads towards its dramatic conclusion. Rachel Riley (pictured with Claudio Ranieri) and Jeff Stelling have fronted Sky's Friday games 'There is so much still to play for at both ends of the table and we will be there every step of the way.' The televised fixtures for May are set to be announced in two batches. The 'first May fixture programme' is due to be released on April 6 with further releases on April 13 and potentially April 20. All of the final weekend's fixtures are set for Sunday 3pm kick-offs on May 21. TV FIXTURES - APRIL 1 - MAY 1 Saturday April 1 12.30pm Liverpool v Everton (Sky Sports) 5.30pm Southampton v AFC Bournemouth (BT Sport) Sunday April 2 1.30pm Swansea City v Middlesbrough (Sky Sports) 4pm Arsenal v Manchester City (Sky Sports) Tuesday April 4 8pm Manchester United v Everton (BT Sport) Wednesday April 5 7.45pm Arsenal v West Ham United* *Consequent to Arsenal v Manchester City moving to Sunday 2 April 7.45pm Hull City v Middlesbrough* *Consequent to Swansea City v Middlesbrough moving to Sunday 2 April 7.45pm Swansea City v Tottenham Hotspur* *Consequent to Swansea City v Middlesbrough moving to Sunday 2 April 8pm Chelsea v Manchester City (BT Sport) Saturday April 8 12.30pm Tottenham Hotspur v Watford (Sky Sports)* *Subject to movement to Sunday 9 April should Arsenal or Leicester City play in the UEFA Champions League on Tuesday 11 April. 5.30pm AFC Bournemouth v Chelsea (BT Sport) Sunday April 9 1.30pm Sunderland v Manchester United (Sky Sports) 4pm Everton v Leicester City (Sky Sports)* *Subject to Leicester City's possible participation in the Champions League on Tuesday 11 April. Monday April 10 8pm Crystal Palace v Arsenal (Sky Sports)* *Subject to Arsenal's possible participation in the Champions League quarter-finals Saturday April 15 12.30pm Tottenham Hotspur v AFC Bournemouth (Sky Sports) 5.30pm Southampton v Manchester City (BT Sport) Sunday April 16 1.30pm West Bromwich Albion v Liverpool (Sky Sports) 4pm Manchester United v Chelsea (Sky Sports) Monday April 17 8pm Middlesbrough v Arsenal (Sky Sports)* *Subject to Arsenal's possible participation in the Champions League quarter-finals Saturday April 22 12.30pm Manchester City v West Bromwich Albion (Sky Sports)* *Subject to Manchester City's possible participation in the FA Cup semi-finals Sunday April 23 12pm Leicester City v Tottenham Hotspur (Sky Sports)* *Subject to Tottenham Hotspur's possible participation in the FA Cup semi-finals 2.15pm Burnley v Manchester United (Sky Sports)* *Subject to Manchester United's possible participation in the FA Cup semi-finals 2.15pm Chelsea v Southampton (Sky Sports)* *Subject to Chelsea's possible participation in the FA Cup semi-finals 4.30pm Liverpool v Crystal Palace (Sky Sports) Saturday April 29 5.30pm Crystal Palace v Burnley (BT Sport) Sunday April 30 12pm Manchester United v Swansea City (BT Sport) 2.05pm Everton v Chelsea (Sky Sports) 4.30pm Tottenham Hotspur v Arsenal (Sky Sports)* *Subject to Arsenal's possible participation in the Champions League semi-finals Monday May 1 8pm Watford v Liverpool (Sky Sports)* RELATED ARTICLES
